summary: Frosty Humor
title: Frosty Humor
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2VWw38V

by shadows_of_glory

(THE TITLE IS SO BAD I’M SORRY BUT THE READER HAS ICE POWERS AND HER HUMOR IS FROSTY SOOOO)

AO3’s summary thing is being a bitch, so please check the first chapter (though it doesn’t really count as one) for full details. (Everything’s in the tags, though…)

Words: 1936, Chapters: 3/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M, Gen, M/M
  • Characters: Tony Stark, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Steve Rogers, Sam Wilson (Marvel), Clint Barton, Wanda Maximoff, Bucky Barnes, Vision, Shannon Carter, Peter Parker, James “Rhodey” Rhodes, Thor (Marvel)
  • Relationships: Tony/Steve, Steve/Bucky, Natasha/Clint, Wanda/Vision, Steve/Shannon, Tony/Pepper
  • Additional Tags: Reader Has Ice Powers (yes; like Elsa), Sam Wilson Is a Good Bro, Wanda Is a Good Bro (sis?), [Y/N] is a Badass, Bucky Is Not Traumatized (But Still Has His Metal Arm), Bucky Is Still a Bit of a Recluse (but is friendly with the others), Reader Is Also an (ex?) Assassin (like Nat and Bucky), She Still Has Lots of Skeletons in Her Closet, Like In Any Other Cliche Story, Her Past Will Catch Up (eventually), She Will Face It Like a Boss, Things Will Go Down With a Bang, Reader/[Y/N] is a Female, this is a test fic, Not Sure If It’ll Continue, I’ll Keep It Going As Long As Possible, (by the way [Y/N] loves to ruin moments), there’s supposed to be rude/sarcastic humor in this, Swearing, /Reader relationships are platonic only, This Fic (whether you support it or not) Explores Many Ships, They Never Go Deep Tho, Mostly For Humor Purposes, I Myself Don’t Ship (literally anything) So This Is New For Me, Feel Free To Give Me Ship Ideas, I’ll Try To Make Them Work (or include them at least), (Vision is Awkwardly Just… “There”…), We’re All Good Friends Tho, (Wanda Takes Care of Him; No Worries), Switches POVs, Time Skips, Author is lazy, Don’t Worry About It, This Has Some Crack In It, it’s supposed to be funny tho, oh well, I Don’t Have High Hopes For This Fic, just so you know, (Not Related To Any Movies), redhead natasha, (BTW Thor adores you), Every Pair is “Sort Of” Together (They’re Not Really a Thing Tho) - Freeform, Reader and Peter Love Meme References - Freeform, (Peter has Shuri’s phone number and introduces Reader to Her) - Freeform, (The three of them are memelords) - Freeform, Nat and You Are Besties - Freeform, You Both Were Separated Back As Children (cliche; yes) - Freeform, You Both Are Now Unstoppable - Freeform, Exasperated T'Challa Has a Surprise Appearance As Well, Thor Adores You BTW, Thor Has His Fabulous Blonde Hair, Don’t Get Me Wrong I Love His New ‘Do, But I’m Giving Him His Old Blonde Hair Back For This Fic, It’s technically in your POV but I write better in first person so… yeah, Reader is 20, Peter Parker is 18, It’s Called “Frosty Humor” But Reader Isn’t Cold To People, I Thought It’d Be Funny Because [Y/N] is Very Sarcastic and Has Ice Powers, I’m Sorry, also, Everything is Beautiful and Nothing Hurts


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2VWw38V

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

summary: Silhouette
title: Silhouette
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2VZzJqK

by LunaDelVille

Some days weren’t good, though. Some days, Steve would feel as if there were strangers in his head - ghostly voices whispering things he refused to hear. They were silent, most of the time, buried by the idyllic life he was living by Tony’s side. But other days, they’d become louder, impossible to ignore. They were like weights over his shoulders, almost too heavy for him to carry. They were blazing flames, uncontrollable and unforgiving. In those days, he’d hold onto to Tony with everything he had, trying to make sure that he’d be safe in his arms.

Words: 1302, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Iron Man (Movies), Captain America (Movies)
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: Major Character Death
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Steve Rogers, Tony Stark
  • Relationships: Steve Rogers/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: there’s a plot twist there, there are clues, Don’t say I didn’t warn you


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2VZzJqK

read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2VZzJqK

summary: What's Your Worst?
title: What's Your Worst?
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2vS0jDg

by viviegirl05

“Unconventional drinking game night!” Darcy announced in the quiet common room as all the Avengers lounged around reading and watching TV. They all looked up at her, startled.
“Define unconventional,” Tony looked suspicious.
“It’s called what’s your worst and I just made it up!” Darcy cried excitedly. “Here’s how it works: we pick a thing, like birthday or gift or whatever, and everyone tells what their worst one was and everyone takes a drink when they tell a story. Whoever wins the round by having the worst experience has to chug their entire drink.”

***

The Avengers and Darcy play yet another drinking game.

Words: 4633, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 4 of Drinking Games

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Characters: Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Clint Barton, Peter Parker, Darcy Lewis, James “Rhodey” Rhodes, Steve Rogers, Sam Wilson, Wanda Maximoff, James “Bucky” Barnes, Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Drinking, Drinking Games


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2vS0jDg

blog.name: ask-starker
blog.title:
Ask Mr. and Mr. Stark
everybody is 20+
blog.description:
bold text: Tony

Italics: Peter

Main: @twink-Peter

Ask anything you want about mine and Peter’s relationship

summary: Aw petey, I'm hurt. We had such fun together though...... ;)
question: Aw petey, I'm hurt. We had such fun together though...... ;)
answer: I definitely don’t recall having any fun with you, I just remember hating myself because of you. You better watch out Skip once Tony gets back from his trip you’ll have to answer to him.

summary: Tony Stark taught me to get back up. Taught me that I wasn’t my fears, that I wasn’t other people’s doubts, taught me who a hero...
body:
Tony Stark taught me to get back up. Taught me that I wasn’t my fears, that I wasn’t other people’s doubts, taught me who a hero was, and who I could be. He taught me how to be me. 

Steve Rogers taught me hope, and belief. He taught me to believe in people, in things greater than myself. He taught me to believe, and to fight for what I wanted, for the good, for the things worth fighting for. He taught me belief.

Natasha Romanov taught me the power of believing in myself. She redefined who I thought I was. She taught me how to own my own body, my own worth, my own mind. She taught me how to be who I was without compromising parts of who I want to be. She taught me survival.

Bruce Banner taught me that we are always, always, more than what other people say we are. He taught me that despite limitations, I could be exactly who I wanted to be. He taught me to question what I was taught, he taught me that I didn’t have to be complacent in my own judgement. He taught me acceptance.

Thor taught me that we aren’t our worst acts, but rather, the things we do to change them. He taught me that it was never too late, that it would never be too late for change. He taught me what loyalty is. He taught me faith.

Clint taught me that we are not our abilities, but rather, our hearts. What we are willing to do to effect change, not just what we can do to make change. He taught me that it never mattered, what your name was, what you’d done, but rather, it matters what you will do. He taught me spirit. 

They’re fictional characters, but that will never mean that they didn’t have a real impact.

trail.content:

Steve Rogers taught me hope, and belief. He taught me to believe in people, in things greater than myself. He taught me to believe, and to fight for what I wanted, for the good, for the things worth fighting for. He taught me belief.

Natasha Romanov taught me the power of believing in myself. She redefined who I thought I was. She taught me how to own my own body, my own worth, my own mind. She taught me how to be who I was without compromising parts of who I want to be. She taught me survival.

Thor taught me that we aren’t our worst acts, but rather, the things we do to change them. He taught me that it was never too late, that it would never be too late for change. He taught me what loyalty is. He taught me faith.

summary: Tell Me A Story
title: Tell Me A Story
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2HexlnV

by IdiotsPlayingVideoGames

*ENDGAME SPOILERS*

Morgan demands bedtime stories, but fairy-tales are not what she wants. Instead, Tony tells the stories he knows best. Stories of scientists and vikings. Archers and spies. The heroes he knew long before she was born.

~~~~~~~~~
After watching endgame, this idea came to me. Hope you like it. It’s mostly done, so I’ll be posting the chapters daily in all likelihood.

Words: 529, Chapters: 1/7, Language: English

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: Major Character Death
  • Categories: Gen
  • Characters: Tony Stark, Morgan Stark (Marvel Cinematic Universe), Pepper Potts, Peter Parker, Steve Rogers, Thor (Marvel), Clint Barton, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Bruce Banner, James “Bucky” Barnes, more characters mentioned in passing
  • Relationships: Pepper Potts/Tony Stark, Pepper Potts & Morgan Stark (Marvel Cinematic Universe) & Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Family, endgame spoilers, Story within a Story


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2HexlnV
